verses.text: Woe to thee that spoilest, and thou wast not spoiled; and dealest treacherously, and they dealt not treacherously with thee! when thou shalt cease to spoil, thou shalt be spoiled; and when thou shalt make an end to deal treacherously, they shall deal treacherously with thee.

similars.text: Yet if thou warn the wicked, and he turn not from his wickedness, nor from his wicked way, he shall die in his iniquity; but thou hast delivered thy soul.
Thou shalt eat, but not be satisfied; and thy casting down shall be in the midst of thee; and thou shalt take hold, but shalt not deliver; and that which thou deliverest will I give up to the sword.
Nevertheless, if thou warn the wicked of his way to turn from it; if he do not turn from his way, he shall die in his iniquity; but thou hast delivered thy soul.

That this shall be no grief unto thee, nor offence of heart unto my lord, either that thou hast shed blood causeless, or that my lord hath avenged himself: but when the Lord shall have dealt well with my lord, then remember thine handmaid.
Wherefore then didst thou not obey the voice of the Lord, but didst fly upon the spoil, and didst evil in the sight of the Lord?

Righteous art thou, O Lord, when I plead with thee: yet let me talk with thee of thy judgments: Wherefore doth the way of the wicked prosper? wherefore are all they happy that deal very treacherously?
As saith the proverb of the ancients, Wickedness proceedeth from the wicked: but mine hand shall not be upon thee.
If thou be wise, thou shalt be wise for thyself: but if thou scornest, thou alone shalt bear it.

verses.text: O Lord, be gracious unto us; we have waited for thee: be thou their arm every morning, our salvation also in the time of trouble.

similars.text: I have waited for thy salvation, O Lord.
And it shall be said in that day, Lo, this is our God; we have waited for him, and he will save us: this is the Lord; we have waited for him, we will be glad and rejoice in his salvation.
Make haste to help me, O Lord my salvation.
Our soul waiteth for the Lord: he is our help and our shield.
Let thy mercy, O Lord, be upon us, according as we hope in thee.
Shew us thy mercy, O Lord, and grant us thy salvation.
I have waited for thy salvation, O Lord.

verses.text: At the noise of the tumult the people fled; at the lifting up of thyself the nations were scattered.
And your spoil shall be gathered like the gathering of the caterpiller: as the running to and fro of locusts shall he run upon them.

similars.text: There shall the fire devour thee; the sword shall cut thee off, it shall eat thee up like the cankerworm: make thyself many as the cankerworm, make thyself many as the locusts.
There shall the fire devour thee; the sword shall cut thee off, it shall eat thee up like the cankerworm: make thyself many as the cankerworm, make thyself many as the locusts.
Thou shalt carry much seed out into the field, and shalt gather but little in; for the locust shall consume it.

verses.text: The Lord is exalted; for he dwelleth on high: he hath filled Zion with judgment and righteousness.

similars.text: Blessed be the Lord out of Zion, which dwelleth at Jerusalem. Praise ye the Lord.
But the Lord of Hosts shall be exalted in judgment, and God that is holy shall be sanctified in righteousness.
But the Lord of hosts shall be exalted in judgment, and God that is holy shall be sanctified in righteousness.
The Lord is great in Zion; and he is high above all the people.
The Lord that made heaven and earth bless thee out of Zion.
For the Lord hath chosen Zion; he hath desired it for his habitation.
The Lord hath brought forth our righteousness: come, and let us declare in Zion the work of the Lord our God.
He loveth righteousness and judgment: the earth is full of the goodness of the Lord.
Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens: and thy glory above all the earth;
Who is like unto the Lord our God, who dwelleth on high,
Therefore, verily, thus saith the Lord, let Zion rejoice, for this is Zion--the pure in heart; therefore, let Zion rejoice, while all the wicked shall mourn.
Sing praises to the Lord, which dwelleth in Zion: declare among the people his doings.
The Lord shall bless thee out of Zion: and thou shalt see the good of Jerusalem all the days of thy life.
When the Lord shall build up Zion, he shall appear in his glory.
And saviours shall come up on mount Zion to judge the mount of Esau; and the kingdom shall be the Lord's.
Zion shall be redeemed with judgment, and her converts with righteousness.
Blessed be the Lord thy God, which delighted in thee, to set thee on the throne of Israel: because the Lord loved Israel for ever, therefore made he thee king, to do judgment and justice.
For the righteous Lord loveth righteousness; his countenance doth behold the upright.
Behold, my servant shall deal prudently; he shall be exalted and extolled and be very high.
Behold, my servant shall deal prudently, he shall be exalted and extolled, and be very high.
For thou, Lord, art high above all the earth: thou art exalted far above all gods.
And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God is judge himself. Selah.
The Lord liveth; and blessed be my rock; and exalted be the God of the rock of my salvation.
The Lord is great in Zion; and he is high above all the people.
For the Lord hath chosen Zion; he hath desired it for his habitation.
But the Lord of hosts shall be exalted in judgment, and God that is holy shall be sanctified in righteousness.
But the Lord of Hosts shall be exalted in judgment, and God that is holy shall be sanctified in righteousness.
The Lord hath brought forth our righteousness: come, and let us declare in Zion the work of the Lord our God.
He loveth righteousness and judgment: the earth is full of the goodness of the Lord.
The Lord executeth righteousness and judgment for all that are oppressed.

verses.text: And wisdom and knowledge shall be the stability of thy times, and strength of salvation: the fear of the Lord is his treasure.

similars.text: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom: and the knowledge of the holy is understanding.
The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom: a good understanding have all they that do his commandments: his praise endureth for ever.
Then shalt thou understand the fear of the Lord, and find the knowledge of God.
The fear of man bringeth a snare: but whoso putteth his trust in the Lord shall be safe.
And unto man he said, Behold, the fear of the Lord, that is wisdom; and to depart from evil is understanding.
Stablish thy word unto thy servant, who is devoted to thy fear.
In the fear of the Lord is strong confidence: and his children shall have a place of refuge.
The Lord is good, a strong hold in the day of trouble; and he knoweth them that trust in him.
The fear of the Lord is the instruction of wisdom; and before honour is humility.
And the Spirit of the Lord shall rest upon him, the spirit of wisdom and understanding, the spirit of counsel and might, the spirit of knowledge and of the fear of the Lord;
And the spirit of the Lord shall rest upon him, the spirit of wisdom and understanding, the spirit of counsel and might, the spirit of knowledge and of the fear of the Lord;
He shall not be afraid of evil tidings: his heart is fixed, trusting in the Lord.
The Lord is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? the Lord is the strength of my life; of whom shall I be afraid?
The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom: a good understanding have all they that do his commandments: his praise endureth for ever.

verses.text: Behold, their valiant ones shall cry without: the ambassadors of peace shall weep bitterly.
The highways lie waste, the wayfaring man ceaseth: he hath broken the covenant, he hath despised the cities, he regardeth no man.

similars.text: And an highway shall be there, and a way, and it shall be called The way of holiness; the unclean shall not pass over it; but it shall be for those: the wayfaring men, though fools, shall not err therein.
He scorneth the multitude of the city, neither regardeth he the crying of the driver.

verses.text: The earth mourneth and languisheth: Lebanon is ashamed and hewn down: Sharon is like a wilderness; and Bashan and Carmel shake off their fruits.

similars.text: He rebuketh the sea, and maketh it dry, and drieth up all the rivers: Bashan languisheth, and Carmel, and the flower of Lebanon languisheth.

verses.text: Now will I rise, saith the Lord; now will I be exalted; now will I lift up myself.

similars.text: Be thou exalted, Lord, in thine own strength: so will we sing and praise thy power.
Unto thee, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.
And now shall mine head be lifted up above mine enemies round about me: therefore will I offer in his tabernacle sacrifices of joy; I will sing, yea, I will sing praises unto the Lord.
Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and he shall lift you up.
And I will strengthen them in the Lord; and they shall walk up and down in his name, saith the Lord.
Rejoice the soul of thy servant: for unto thee, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.
Thou art my God, and I will praise thee: thou art my God, I will exalt thee.
I will extol thee, O Lord; for thou hast lifted me up, and hast not made my foes to rejoice over me.
And I, if I be lifted up from the earth, will draw all men unto me.
Be still, and know that I am God: I will be exalted among the heathen, I will be exalted in the earth.
For thou hast said in thine heart, I will ascend into heaven, I will exalt my throne above the stars of God: I will sit also upon the mount of the congregation, in the sides of the north:
Thus will I bless thee while I live: I will lift up my hands in thy name.
I will lift up mine eyes unto the hills, from whence cometh my help.
What then shall I do when God riseth up? and when he visiteth, what shall I answer him?
Humble yourselves therefore under the mighty hand of God, that he may exalt you in due time:
When my father and my mother forsake me, then the Lord will take me up.
Behold, I am Jesus Christ, the Son of God, and I will lift them up at the last day. Even so. Amen.

Yea, I know that God will give liberally to him that asketh. Yea, my God will give me, if I ask not amiss; therefore I will lift up my voice unto thee; yea, I will cry unto thee, my God, the rock of my righteousness. Behold, my voice shall forever ascend up unto thee, my rock and mine everlasting God. Amen.
For whosoever exalteth himself shall be abased; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted.
For thou hast said in thy heart: I will ascend into heaven, I will exalt my throne above the stars of God; I will sit also upon the mount of the congregation, in the sides of the north;
Lift up your heads, O ye gates; and be ye lift up, ye everlasting doors; and the King of glory shall come in.
And whosoever shall exalt himself shall be abased; and he that shall humble himself shall be exalted.
The Lord thy God will raise up unto thee a Prophet from the midst of thee, of thy brethren, like unto me; unto him ye shall hearken;
Let him therefore abase himself that he may be exalted. Even so. Amen.
For I will raise up unto myself a pure people, that will serve me in righteousness;
Therefore, if ye do these things blessed are ye, for ye shall be lifted up at the last day.
The Lord is my strength and song, and he is become my salvation: he is my God, and I will prepare him an habitation; my father's God, and I will exalt him.

verses.text: Ye shall conceive chaff, ye shall bring forth stubble: your breath, as fire, shall devour you.

similars.text: Wherefore thus saith the Lord God of hosts, Because ye speak this word, behold, I will make my words in thy mouth fire, and this people wood, and it shall devour them.

Behold, my brethren, I say unto you, that these things must shortly come; yea, even blood, and fire, and vapor of smoke must come; and it must needs be upon the face of this earth; and it cometh unto men according to the flesh if it so be that they will harden their hearts against the Holy One of Israel.

Therefore, as the fire devoureth the stubble, and the flame consumeth the chaff, their root shall be rottenness, and their blossoms shall go up as dust; because they have cast away the law of the Lord of Hosts, and despised the word of the Holy One of Israel.
Yea, I will gather you, and blow upon you in the fire of my wrath, and ye shall be melted in the midst thereof.

And I will set my jealousy against thee, and they shall deal furiously with thee: they shall take away thy nose and thine ears; and thy remnant shall fall by the sword: they shall take thy sons and thy daughters; and thy residue shall be devoured by the fire.

Therefore as the fire devoureth the stubble, and the flame consumeth the chaff, so their root shall be as rottenness, and their blossom shall go up as dust: because they have cast away the law of the Lord of hosts, and despised the word of the Holy One of Israel.

The Lord shall smite thee with a consumption, and with a fever, and with an inflammation, and with an extreme burning, and with the sword, and with blasting, and with mildew; and they shall pursue thee until thou perish.
Behold, the name of the Lord cometh from far, burning with his anger, and the burden thereof is heavy: his lips are full of indignation, and his tongue as a devouring fire:

Thou hast defiled thy sanctuaries by the multitude of thine iniquities, by the iniquity of thy traffick; therefore will I bring forth a fire from the midst of thee, it shall devour thee, and I will bring thee to ashes upon the earth in the sight of all them that behold thee.
And shall cast them into the furnace of fire: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth.
They shall be burnt with hunger, and devoured with burning heat, and with bitter destruction: I will also send the teeth of beasts upon them, with the poison of serpents of the dust.
For thou shalt heap coals of fire upon his head, and the Lord shall reward thee.
There shall the fire devour thee; the sword shall cut thee off, it shall eat thee up like the cankerworm: make thyself many as the cankerworm, make thyself many as the locusts.

verses.text: And the people shall be as the burnings of lime: as thorns cut up shall they be burned in the fire.

similars.text: For wickedness burneth as the fire: it shall devour the briers and thorns, and shall kindle in the thickets of the forest, and they shall mount up like the lifting up of smoke.
For wickedness burneth as the fire; it shall devour the briers and thorns, and shall kindle in the thickets of the forests, and they shall mount up like the lifting up of smoke.
As therefore the tares are gathered and burned in the fire; so shall it be in the end of this world.

The Lord shall smite thee with a consumption, and with a fever, and with an inflammation, and with an extreme burning, and with the sword, and with blasting, and with mildew; and they shall pursue thee until thou perish.
It is burned with fire, it is cut down: they perish at the rebuke of thy countenance.
But the man that shall touch them must be fenced with iron and the staff of a spear; and they shall be utterly burned with fire in the same place.
Wherefore thus saith the Lord God of hosts, Because ye speak this word, behold, I will make my words in thy mouth fire, and this people wood, and it shall devour them.
There shall the fire devour thee; the sword shall cut thee off, it shall eat thee up like the cankerworm: make thyself many as the cankerworm, make thyself many as the locusts.
If fire break out, and catch in thorns, so that the stacks of corn, or the standing corn, or the field, be consumed therewith; he that kindled the fire shall surely make restitution.
And shall cast them into a furnace of fire: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth.
And put fire therein, and put incense in them before the Lord to morrow: and it shall be that the man whom the Lord doth choose, he shall be holy: ye take too much upon you, ye sons of Levi.
But thus shall ye deal with them; ye shall destroy their altars, and break down their images, and cut down their groves, and burn their graven images with fire.
And whoso falleth not down and worshippeth shall the same hour be cast into the midst of a burning fiery furnace.
And shall cast them into the furnace of fire: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth.

This shall be thine of the most holy things, reserved from the fire: every oblation of theirs, every meat offering of theirs, and every sin offering of theirs, and every trespass offering of theirs, which they shall render unto me, shall be most holy for thee and for thy sons.
But I will punish you according to the fruit of your doings, saith the Lord: and I will kindle a fire in the forest thereof, and it shall devour all things round about it.

verses.text: Hear, ye that are far off, what I have done; and, ye that are near, acknowledge my might.
The sinners in Zion are afraid; fearfulness hath surprised the hypocrites. Who among us shall dwell with the devouring fire? who among us shall dwell with everlasting burnings?

similars.text: And he shall pass over to his strong hold for fear, and his princes shall be afraid of the ensign, saith the Lord, whose fire is in Zion, and his furnace in Jerusalem.
Let not thine heart envy sinners: but be thou in the fear of the Lord all the day long.

verses.text: He that walketh righteously, and speaketh uprightly; he that despiseth the gain of oppressions, that shaketh his hands from holding of bribes, that stoppeth his ears from hearing of blood, and shutteth his eyes from seeing evil;

similars.text: He that walketh in his uprightness feareth the Lord: but he that is perverse in his ways despiseth him.

Thou art of purer eyes than to behold evil, and canst not look on iniquity: wherefore lookest thou upon them that deal treacherously, and holdest thy tongue when the wicked devoureth the man that is more righteous than he?
He that turneth away his ear from hearing the law, even his prayer shall be abomination.
He delivereth the poor in his affliction, and openeth their ears in oppression.

Now therefore, my lord, as the Lord liveth, and as thy soul liveth, seeing the Lord hath withholden thee from coming to shed blood, and from avenging thyself with thine own hand, now let thine enemies, and they that seek evil to my lord, be as Nabal.
O that he would rid you from this iniquity and abomination. And, O that ye would listen unto the word of his commands, and let not this pride of your hearts destroy your souls!
And shall make him of quick understanding in the fear of the Lord; and he shall not judge after the sight of his eyes, neither reprove after the hearing of his ears.
And shall make him of quick understanding in the fear of the Lord: and he shall not judge after the sight of his eyes, neither reprove after the hearing of his ears:
He that refuseth instruction despiseth his own soul: but he that heareth reproof getteth understanding.
He shutteth his eyes to devise froward things: moving his lips he bringeth evil to pass.
Let not him that eateth despise him that eateth not; and let not him which eateth not judge him that eateth: for God hath received him.
Yea, thou shalt go forth from him, and thine hands upon thine head: for the Lord hath rejected thy confidences, and thou shalt not prosper in them.
He will regard the prayer of the destitute, and not despise their prayer.
Is it good unto thee that thou shouldest oppress, that thou shouldest despise the work of thine hands, and shine upon the counsel of the wicked?
He that speaketh truth sheweth forth righteousness: but a false witness deceit.
He that walketh uprightly, and worketh righteousness, and speaketh the truth in his heart.
He that hath clean hands, and a pure heart; who hath not lifted up his soul unto vanity, nor sworn deceitfully.

verses.text: He shall dwell on high: his place of defence shall be the munitions of rocks: bread shall be given him; his waters shall be sure.
Thine eyes shall see the king in his beauty: they shall behold the land that is very far off.
Thine heart shall meditate terror. Where is the scribe? where is the receiver? where is he that counted the towers?
Thou shalt not see a fierce people, a people of a deeper speech than thou canst perceive; of a stammering tongue, that thou canst not understand.

similars.text: Thou art of purer eyes than to behold evil, and canst not look on iniquity: wherefore lookest thou upon them that deal treacherously, and holdest thy tongue when the wicked devoureth the man that is more righteous than he?
Saying, Go unto this people, and say, Hearing ye shall hear, and shall not understand; and seeing ye shall see, and not perceive:

verses.text: Look upon Zion, the city of our solemnities: thine eyes shall see Jerusalem a quiet habitation, a tabernacle that shall not be taken down; not one of the stakes thereof shall ever be removed, neither shall any of the cords thereof be broken.

similars.text: Awake, awake, put on thy strength, O Zion; put on thy beautiful garments, O Jerusalem, the holy city; for henceforth there shall no more come into thee the uncircumcised and the unclean.
Awake, awake; put on thy strength, O Zion; put on thy beautiful garments, O Jerusalem, the holy city: for henceforth there shall no more come into thee the uncircumcised and the unclean.
In that day it shall be said to Jerusalem, Fear thou not: and to Zion, Let not thine hands be slack.
And thou shalt know that thy tabernacle shall be in peace; and thou shalt visit thy habitation, and shalt not sin.
So shall ye know that I am the Lord your God dwelling in Zion, my holy mountain: then shall Jerusalem be holy, and there shall no strangers pass through her any more.
For the people shall dwell in Zion at Jerusalem: thou shalt weep no more: he will be very gracious unto thee at the voice of thy cry; when he shall hear it, he will answer thee.

And the nations of the earth shall honor her, and shall say: Surely Zion is the city of our God, and surely Zion cannot fall, neither be moved out of her place, for God is there, and the hand of the Lord is there;

And whatsoever city thy servants shall enter, and the people of that city receive their testimony, let thy peace and thy salvation be upon that city; that they may gather out of that city the righteous, that they may come forth to Zion, or to her stakes, the places of thine appointment, with songs of everlasting joy;

And then shall be brought to pass that which is written: Awake, awake again, and put on thy strength, O Zion; put on thy beautiful garments, O Jerusalem, the holy city, for henceforth there shall no more come into thee the uncircumcised and the unclean.
And men shall dwell in it, and there shall be no more utter destruction; but Jerusalem shall be safely inhabited.

And awake, and arise from the dust, O Jerusalem; yea, and put on thy beautiful garments, O daughter of Zion; and strengthen thy stakes and enlarge thy borders forever, that thou mayest no more be confounded, that the covenants of the Eternal Father which he hath made unto thee, O house of Israel, may be fulfilled.

And now, behold, I say unto you that it is not revealed, and no man knoweth where the city Zion shall be built, but it shall be given hereafter. Behold, I say unto you that it shall be on the borders by the Lamanites.

And thou hast taken Zion to thine own bosom, from all thy creations, from all eternity to all eternity; and naught but peace, justice, and truth is the habitation of thy throne; and mercy shall go before thy face and have no end; how is it thou canst weep?
It shall dwell in his tabernacle, because it is none of his: brimstone shall be scattered upon his habitation.
They that trust in the Lord shall be as mount Zion, which cannot be removed, but abideth for ever.

And the nations of the earth shall honor her, and shall say: Surely Zion is the city of our God, and surely Zion cannot fall, neither be moved out of her place, for God is there, and the hand of the Lord is there;
So shall ye know that I am the Lord your God dwelling in Zion, my holy mountain: then shall Jerusalem be holy, and there shall no strangers pass through her any more.

verses.text: But there the glorious Lord will be unto us a place of broad rivers and streams; wherein shall go no galley with oars, neither shall gallant ship pass thereby.

similars.text: Wherefore, the days will come that no flesh shall be safe upon the waters.

When thou passest through the waters, I will be with thee; and through the rivers, they shall not overflow thee: when thou walkest through the fire, thou shalt not be burned; neither shall the flame kindle upon thee.

verses.text: For the Lord is our judge, the Lord is our lawgiver, the Lord is our king; he will save us.

similars.text: Therefore I will be your king the remainder of my days; nevertheless, let us appoint judges, to judge this people according to our law; and we will newly arrange the affairs of this people, for we will appoint wise men to be judges, that will judge this people according to the commandments of God.
For the Lord shall be in their midst, and his glory shall be upon them, and he will be their king and their lawgiver.
I will be thy king: where is any other that may save thee in all thy cities? and thy judges of whom thou saidst, Give me a king and princes?
For the Lord is our defence; and the Holy One of Israel is our king.
And said to the judges, Take heed what ye do: for ye judge not for man, but for the Lord, who is with you in the judgment.
Save, Lord: let the king hear us when we call.
Give the king thy judgments, O God, and thy righteousness unto the king's son.
Blessed is the man whom thou chastenest, O Lord, and teachest him out of thy law;
There is one lawgiver, who is able to save and to destroy: who art thou that judgest another?
Our soul waiteth for the Lord: he is our help and our shield.
For the Lord is our defence; and the Holy One of Israel is our king.
For the Lord shall be in their midst, and his glory shall be upon them, and he will be their king and their lawgiver.

verses.text: Thy tacklings are loosed; they could not well strengthen their mast, they could not spread the sail: then is the prey of a great spoil divided; the lame take the prey.
And the inhabitant shall not say, I am sick: the people that dwell therein shall be forgiven their iniquity.

similars.text: And inasmuch as my people build a house unto me in the name of the Lord, and do not suffer any unclean thing to come into it, that it be not defiled, my glory shall rest upon it;
And my people shall dwell in a peaceable habitation, and in sure dwellings, and in quiet resting places;
